FacilityName: Hickory Springs of California - Commerce, CA

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary

Hickory Springs Manufacturing Co.
Hickory Springs of California, Inc.
Commerce, CA

Hickory Springs Manufacturing Co. and its subsidiary operations are committed to operating and maintaining its facilities and processes in a safe and responsible manner, which provides safe conditions for Company employees, the surrounding community and the environment. 

Our Commerce facility manufactures flexible polyurethane (PU) foam products via two processes (polyether PU foam and polyester PU foam) for the furniture and bedding industries.  One of the major chemical ingredients used in the Pu foam manufacturing process is Toluene diisocyante (mixed isomers) (TDI), CAS #  26471-62-5.

As stated in our initial RMP registration, a concrete containment area for the railcar unloading station was to be constructed.  Construction of that area was delayed because of permitting and other requirements, but eventually completed in September 2001. This facility now meets the Program 1 eligibility requirements. The purpose of this revision to the facility's RMP is to reclassify the Program Level from a 2 to a 1.

Two commercial blends are used at the facility.  These blends have isomer ratios of TDI 2-4 (CAS # 584-84-9) and TDI 2-6 (CAS # 91-08-7) approximately 80/20 and 65/35  respectively.  Our TDI inventory is maintained above 10,000 lbs.  In accordance with the provisions of 40 CFR 68 (Risk Management Program Regulations - RMP), the worst case scenario was defined as the rupture of, and the immediate spillage of, the contents of a TDI 80/20 railcar into a concrete containment area.  The impact of this spill was evaluated using the ALOHA model and resulted in the area of concern with no public receptors being affected within a 26 yard radius of the railcar unloading station which classifies the polyether pu foam manufacturing process at this facility as a Program Level 1.  The release rate, calculated by the ALOHA model, was 0.0101 lbs./min.  Two alternate scenarios-

the rupture and spillage of TDI 80/20 from the largest storage tanks, which are located within concrete containment areas, were also evaluated using the ALOHA model and resulted in the areas of concern being confined within the facility's property boundary and no public receptors being affected.  The release rates for the alternate scenarios, calculated by the ALOHA model, were from 0.0101 to 0.0177 lbs./min.

TDI 65/35 is used exclusively by the polyester Pu foam manufacturing process and is delivered in tank truck quantities.  The worst case scenario for TDI 65/35 was defined as the rupture of, and the immediate spill of, the contents of the 5,000 gallon storage tank into a concrete containment area. The impact of this spill was evaluated using the ALOHA model and resulted in the area of concern which does not affecting public receptors.  This result classifies the polyester PU foam manufacturing process at this facility as a Program Level 1.  The release rate, calculated by the ALOHA model, was 0.0639 lbs./min.

This facility has a hazmat team, which will provide initial response to any and all spills, despite the substance or size.  This facility also has contracted professional emergency responders as back-up.  If required, the assistance of the Los Angeles County fire department hazmat team will be requested.  This facility's emergency response and contingency plan has been coordinated with the LEPC, local fire department and the local fire department hazmat commander.  All employees responsible for the handling and control of hazardous substances are provided initial and refresher training in proper procedures as required by EPA, OSHA and DOT standards and regulations.

There have been no accidents with regard to spillage of substances at this facility within the last five years.
